channel.title: 300 - The movie
channel.description: Has anyone seen 300? I just saw it like an hour ago o.O Nothing better than old fashioned brutality and gore :) I'm going to buy the game for the PSP for my birthday coming up on April 19th. I wish they showed you how many people got killed on the *LAST* battle at the very end...but then there came the credits :(

item.title: 300 - The movie
item.dc:creator: @voiD_dev voiD dev
item.description:
@voiD_dev wrote:

300 men. I would laugh at that statement if the the movie was historically based. What was the goat-headed man doing in the whore tent. It looked out of place. For the movie rating I would give it an 7 out of 10. Partly because of the well generated effects and my friend’s uncle working on the shadow effects.

This movie was based on another older version of the ‘300’:

item.title: 300 - The movie
item.dc:creator: @ninjasod ninjasod
item.description:
@ninjasod wrote:

00000001:

It is NOT based on historical facts, don’t pull out shit out of your ass.

Just because it’s not word to word doesn’t mean that it’s not based on it. Just like kmb said, there’s a difference between when something is based on something and when something it is completely reconstructed.

Btw, sorry for posting this like 3 weeks after you guys did, I haven’t been on for awhile T_T

Read full topic

item.title: 300 - The movie
item.dc:creator: @kmb Kmb
item.description:
@kmb wrote:

I didn’t comment on whether it is based on historical facts or not. I was quoting ninjasod on that matter. I was trying to make a difference between when something is based on something and when something is completely reconstructed.

Btw, hai Xerxes.

Read full topic

item.title: 300 - The movie
item.description:
@00000001 wrote:

[quote=“ninjasod, post:63, topic:66376”][quote author=Fr33sc4p3 link=topic=96874.msg1246291#msg1246291 date=1177991536]
K ITS FAKE n STUF
[/quote]
It’s based on historical facts[/quote]

Kmb:

Therefore ninjasod said it is BASED on historical facts. It would’ve been a bit too much for the actors to learn a new language before the filming, wouldn’t it?

It is NOT based on historical facts, don’t pull out shit out of your ass.

The only true thing is that the battle did took place, the rest, is different.

http://forums.tweakguides.com/showthread.php?p=65050#post65050

Read and learn friends.

item.title: 300 - The movie
item.dc:creator: @kripz kripz
item.description:
@kripz wrote:

[quote=“regecks`, post:56, topic:66376”]Tbh awful US propaganda movie, I saw it last night at the cinemas: wanted to fall asleep.

[quote]Movie sucks & is very historically inaccurate.
3/10[/quote]You are correct.

2 hours of killing and we don’t get to see Xerxes die? ???

Blood effects &c were a giant throwback to like 500 million years ago plz, might as well not include them.
Also, half the spartan warriors had bigger breasts than half the women lel.

While yes, I guess the story was alright, good even, and it’s fine that the Spartan king didn’t defeat Xerxes and died &c &c &c, I think the actual execution of the movie was pretty awful. Slo-mo at the most inappropriate moments, humor at really bad moments, the story about what was going on back in Sparta barely made a difference :(.

Tbh 3/10.[/quote]

Couldnt agree more

Heres my movie review, sums up the whole movie:

Heaps good movie?

THIS IS SPARTA
Shows Abs
Show Slomo Abs
Credits

One part really pissed me off.

The spartans are portrayed as ruthless killers etc etc.

King and captain are like, if you die in battle its an honor, your son will replace you.

Then when the captains son dies he cries like a fucking bitch.

Fuck i wanted to headbutt the theatre walls.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @mjordan mjordan
item.description:
@mjordan wrote:

regecks`:

Also, half the spartan warriors had bigger breasts than half the women lel.

item.title: 300 - The movie
item.dc:creator: @regecks1 regecks`
item.description:
@regecks1 wrote:

Tbh awful US propaganda movie, I saw it last night at the cinemas: wanted to fall asleep.

Movie sucks & is very historically inaccurate. 3/10
You are correct.

2 hours of killing and we don’t get to see Xerxes die? ???

Blood effects &c were a giant throwback to like 500 million years ago plz, might as well not include them.
Also, half the spartan warriors had bigger breasts than half the women lel.

While yes, I guess the story was alright, good even, and it’s fine that the Spartan king didn’t defeat Xerxes and died &c &c &c, I think the actual execution of the movie was pretty awful. Slo-mo at the most inappropriate moments, humor at really bad moments, the story about what was going on back in Sparta barely made a difference :(.

Tbh 3/10.

Read full topic

item.title: 300 - The movie
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

Holy shit the camera shots were fucking amazing. Wow… if you want to see this movie watch it at the cinema no where else.

Best movie I’ve ever seen imo. Loved the story. Loved the fighting. Loved the blood. I had no idea Xerxes was homosexual until i saw this film.

Read full topic

item.title: 300 - The movie
item.dc:creator: @Cheesehunk Cheesehunk
item.description:
@Cheesehunk wrote:

mjordan:

EDIT: Does anyone remember what Leonidas says at the beginning when the Persian messengers come? He walks around with them then he kicks the main one into the huge hole, and right before he does it he goes “This isn’t …THIS IS SPARTA!”. Does anyone remember what he fully says there?

“Madman! This is Madness!”
Leonidas lowers sword and looks around at everyone
“Madness… Turns around, looks at wife who shakes head signifying some sort of ‘do it’ speach THIS IS SPARTA!”

Read full topic

item.title: 300 - The movie
item.dc:creator: @mjordan mjordan
item.description:
@mjordan wrote:

Cheesehunk:

My least favourite part is when the Persian girls are making out and then one turns around and her face is awkwardly shaped.

Yeah I was like “well hey thats pretty nice” then when she turned around I was like “AAHHHH”. But it was a pretty amazing movie. I thought the end could have been a little better, but it was still ok. 10/10 from me!

EDIT: Does anyone remember what Leonidas says at the beginning when the Persian messengers come? He walks around with them then he kicks the main one into the huge hole, and right before he does it he goes “This isn’t …THIS IS SPARTA!”. Does anyone remember what he fully says there?

Read full topic
